original: You know the drill.

original: Do you see that house? It's mine.

original: Please listen and type in Spanish.

original: Pharamp wishes Trang good night even though she knows that she is not in bed at this hour.
translated: Pharamp souhaite la bonne nuit à Trang, même si elle sait qu'elle n'est pas en train de dormir à cette heure-là.

original: Don't stay up too late.

original: If I had a nickel for everytime a woman has turned me down, I'd be a rich man!

original: Don't worry. You can always count on me.

original: I hope you like what I've just given you.

original: Be a dear and shut off the light.

original: I should've been watching more carefully.

original: The teacher was over 2 meters tall and could easily put his hands on the ceiling.

original: Tom is packing.
translated: Tom fait ses bagages.

original: She doesn't believe in God.

original: I listen to music and dance.

original: Were you there often?

original: No one's watching you.

original: Did you hear that, Mike?

original: The problem with windowpanes is they break easily.
translated: Le problème avec les vitres des fenêtres, c'est qu'elles se cassent facilement.

original: Tom isn't good-looking.

original: Show me what you bought.

original: Where's the bassist?

original: She advised him not to drive too fast, but he wouldn't listen to her.

original: Today automobiles track the behavior of drivers: they collect personal data such as speed, route, and driving style, then they upload that information to the car manufacturers or insurance companies.
translated: Aujourd'hui, les automobiles suivent le comportement des conducteurs : ils collectent des données personnelles telles que la vitesse, l'itinéraire et le style de conduite, puis rapportent cette information aux constructeurs automobiles ou compagnies d'assurance.

original: My mother's going to kill me.

original: Tom was early for church.

original: I can swim across the river.

original: Let's be careful not to catch a cold.

original: I think that this is a fake.

original: Do you love your mother?

original: I'll be back in an hour.

original: Nope.

translated: Comme c'est le caractère des grands esprits de faire entendre en peu de paroles beaucoup de choses, les petits esprits au contraire ont le don de beaucoup parler, et de ne rien dire.

original: I think we have some mice in the attic.

original: I have a broken nail.

original: You'd better go home now.

original: The flowers revived after the rain.

original: You can't seriously expect that they won't recognize you in that disguise. That lopsided, dime store moustache is a dead giveaway!
translated: Tu ne peux pas sérieusement escompter qu'ils ne te reconnaîtront pas avec ce déguisement. Cette moustache de travers à deux sous est un indice révélateur instantané !

original: Despite all of the pitfalls, this project turned out to be a huge success.

original: We found one large footprint and a couple of different size smaller footprints.

original: This is quite shocking.

original: Don't think about it. Do it.

original: Porto Alegre is a great city.

original: I've got something else on my mind.

original: Have you already had breakfast?

original: I have to know.

original: It's the gold standard.

original: I am not used to staying up late at night.
translated: Je ne suis pas habitué à veiller tard le soir.

original: I find this book is very difficult to read.

original: What is his age?

original: She went out to buy some food.

original: Tom seems startled.

original: Your name affects your personality.
translated: Ton nom affecte ta personnalité.

original: I don't plan on doing that by myself.

original: Tom, I'm happy for you.

original: I'm observant.

original: I promised her I'd not tell anyone.

original: Give it some thought.

original: When we were kids, we played together every day.

original: He goes to sleep with the lights left on.

original: I should have told you.

original: I applied for a visa.

original: Why do you need them?

original: Why don't you try this one?

original: Unbelievable!

original: Tom would like to leave now.

original: I knew it was serious.

original: Be nice to others.

original: These people are so weird.

original: They walked up to the well.

original: I was poor at English.

original: The criminals have all been apprehended.

original: Few people have two cars.

original: I'm not English.

original: Your bear drinks beer.

original: The telly isn't working.

original: He is at home today.

original: Tom said that Mary might come back on Monday.
translated: Tom a dit que Mary devrait être de retour lundi.

original: I will write letters to you as often as I can.

original: Fool!

original: I just want to dance.

original: Do you regularly experience dry mouth?

original: Do you have seats available for the concert?

original: I need a new bicycle.
translated: J'ai besoin d'un nouveau vélo.

original: Think for a moment.

translated: La liberté est comme l'air raréfié des sommets. Les hommes faibles ne peuvent supporter ni l'un ni l'autre.

original: There is no dog which is bigger than this one.
translated: Il n'y a pas de chien plus grand que celui-ci.

original: I am only too glad to help you with your work.

original: You asked all the right questions.

original: There are almost no books.

original: I'll be at home tomorrow.

original: Abide by your promise.

original: I'd like you to meet my wife.

original: Although he thought he was helping us, he was only in the way.
translated: Bien qu'il pensât nous aider, il ne faisait qu'être dans nos pattes.

original: The earth is just a sphere suspended in space.
translated: La Terre n'est rien d'autre qu'une sphère suspendue dans l'espace.

original: You're very timid.

original: Why do you need to do that?

original: I'm sick of lying.

original: Could you go to the store and grab some eggs?

translated: Tom préfère être seul.

original: They treated me badly.

original: You're insane.

original: What was the geezer saying?

original: I didn't do it on purpose.

original: She pushed me gently.
translated: Elle me poussa avec douceur.

original: I think we ought to change our policy.

original: We had a slight difference of opinion.
translated: Nous avions une légère différence d'opinion.

original: My favorite subjects in high school were geometry and history.
translated: Mes matières préférées, au Lycée, étaient la géométrie et l'histoire.

original: Are you a good golfer?
translated: Es-tu une bonne golfeuse ?

original: From a lexical point of view, Esperanto appears as an Indo-European language, but structurally it is an isolating language, likewise Chinese.
translated: Au point de vue lexical l'espéranto apparaît comme une langue d'origine indo-européenne, mais structurellement elle est une langue isolante pareillement au chinois.

original: I am finishing my translation.
translated: Je termine ma traduction.

original: Poor as he is, he is happy.
translated: Tout pauvre qu'il soit, il est heureux.

original: Where do you place the stress in the word "Australia"?

original: They're going to try.
translated: Ils vont essayer.

original: There was in the centre of the circle, a column made out of copper that supported a crystal egg. And because the sun shone on it, rays of light shot from all sides of the egg.
translated: Il y avait au milieu du cercle une colonne de cuivre supportant un œuf de cristal; et, comme le soleil frappait dessus, des rayons de tous les côtés en partaient.

original: Laws are made to be broken.

original: I can't afford to buy a car.

original: You gave me a headache.

original: Money, as such, has no meaning.

original: Carrefour's Ham offcuts are not expensive at all, but are nonetheless delicious.
translated: Les chutes de jambon de Carrefour ne sont pas chères du tout, mais sont néanmoins délicieuses.

original: I don't really care what you think.

original: She spent Christmas with her family.

original: The baby seemed to be fast asleep.

original: I met you, and that's enough.

original: Both countries entered into peace negotiations.

original: This office has tinted windows.

original: In winter, I feel more tired.

original: Tom is an optometrist.
translated: Tom est optométriste.

original: He stared into space.

original: Tom has a personal bodyguard.

translated: Combien de temps avez-vous été à l'école, aujourd'hui ?

original: Don't touch this!
translated: Ne touche pas à ça !

original: Jeanne is also playing tennis.
translated: Jeanne aussi joue au tennis.

original: That's very strange.
translated: C'est très étrange.

original: I made a desk of wood.
translated: J'ai fabriqué un bureau en bois.

original: Do you mind if I help myself?
translated: Voyez-vous un inconvénient à ce que je me serve ?

original: I would like to make this toast to all those who have given their time to this project. I thank them warmly.
translated: Je voudrais porter ce toast à tous ceux qui ont donné de leur temps à ce projet. Je les remercie chaleureusement.

original: This sounds fishy.
translated: Ça a l'air louche.

original: You did it!
translated: C'est toi qui l'as fait !

original: Sorry, I've got to go.
translated: Désolé, je dois partir.

original: Tom repeated his question.
translated: Tom a répété sa question.

original: Tom said he had a slight cold.
translated: Tom a dit qu'il était un peu enrhumé.

original: She lives far from here.
translated: Elle habite loin d’ici.

original: I shivered.
translated: J'ai tremblé.

original: She doesn't need sympathy, but support.
translated: Elle n'a pas besoin de compassion, mais de soutien.

original: Have a donut.
translated: Prenez un beignet.

original: You have to come with us.
translated: Vous devez venir avec nous.

original: Out of the students, only one had read that book.
translated: Parmi tous les étudiants, un seul avait lu le livre.

original: I wanted to discuss this with you yesterday, but you didn't seem to want to listen.
translated: Je voulais en discuter avec vous, hier, mais vous ne sembliez pas disposés à écouter.

original: Sami did just as he was instructed.
translated: Sami a suivi ses instructions.

original: Tom put the card face down on the table.
translated: Tom a posé la carte face cachée sur la table.

original: I looked up his telephone number in a telephone directory.
translated: J'ai cherché son numéro de téléphone dans un annuaire.

original: You should've gone home already.
translated: Tu devrais déjà être rentrée chez toi.

original: Tom's not ready to quit.
translated: Tom n'est pas prêt à arrêter.

original: It's not difficult if you study.
translated: Ça n'est pas difficile si tu étudies.

original: I'm not married to Tom anymore.
translated: Je ne suis plus mariée avec Tom.

original: I don't have a gun.
translated: Je n'ai pas d'arme à feu.

original: We can't help you anymore.
translated: Nous ne pouvons plus vous aider.

original: Sami was overly flirtatious with his female students.
translated: Sami flirtait trop avec ses étudiantes.

original: I wish Tom was here.
translated: J'aimerais que Tom soit là.

original: It's unsurprising that Yoko would have said something like that.
translated: Il est normal que Yoko ait dit une telle chose.

original: He is unrealistic.
translated: Il est irréaliste.

original: Please forgive me for not having written sooner.
translated: Je te prie de m'excuser de ne pas t'avoir écrit plus tôt.

original: Remember these rules.
translated: Rappelle-toi ces règles.

original: Are you spending Christmas with Tom?
translated: Tu passes Noël avec Tom ?

original: My nose is red.
translated: Mon nez est rouge.

original: Are you going to help us or not?
translated: Vas-tu oui ou non nous aider ?

original: I ordered several books from England.
translated: J'ai commandé plusieurs livres d'Angleterre.

original: This is a tragedy.
translated: C'est une tragédie.

original: I feel seasick.
translated: J'ai le mal de mer.

original: Why did you call me?
translated: Pourquoi m'avez-vous appelé ?

original: Sorry, I was woolgathering.
translated: Désolé, je rêvassais.

original: Beautiful start.
translated: Magnifique début.

original: I don't care if you're busy. Please help me now.
translated: Ça m'est égal que vous soyez occupée. Je vous prie de m'aider maintenant.

original: I paid for it already.
translated: Je l'ai déjà payé.

original: Don't you want to win?
translated: Ne voulez-vous pas gagner ?

original: We have a conversation.
translated: Nous avons une discussion.

original: An eyewitness is worth more than ten auditory witnesses.
translated: Un témoin oculaire vaut plus que dix témoins auditifs.

original: What an idiot I am!
translated: Quel idiot je suis !

original: She was accepted by Harvard.
translated: Elle a été acceptée à Harvard.

original: I sure am glad you weren't hurt.
translated: Je me réjouis certainement que vous n'ayez pas été blessé.

original: Now everything's going smoothly.
translated: Maintenant tout va bien.

original: I took my coat off because it was hot.
translated: J'ai retiré mon manteau parce qu'il faisait chaud.

original: He cried out for help.
translated: Il cria à l'aide.

original: Use this!
translated: Emploie ceci !

original: Don't look for how to do it, find out how not to prevent yourself.
translated: Ne cherche pas comment faire, trouve comment ne pas t'empêcher.

original: The rumour quickly spread.
translated: La rumeur se répandit rapidement.

original: Stop playing video games. You're addicted.
translated: Arrêtez de jouer aux jeux vidéos ! Vous êtes drogués.

original: It's getting dark little by little outside.
translated: Dehors, la lumière baisse progressivement.

original: Your children are so charming!
translated: Vos enfants sont si charmants !

original: Do you know where I can find Tom?
translated: Savez-vous où je pourrais trouver Tom ?

original: Do you know anybody in Australia?
translated: Connais-tu quelqu'un en Australie ?

original: I used to stutter.
translated: Je bégayais avant.

original: I can't finish this part of the puzzle.
translated: Je ne peux pas finir ce morceau du puzzle.

original: That house is small, but it's big enough for us.
translated: Cette maison est petite mais elle est suffisamment grande pour nous.

original: You should be ready for the worst.
translated: Tu devrais t'attendre au pire.
